messages: f4dfad803df83144a5be86d9bca87678 (18:02): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: certainly is, thanks. have not read it carefully. i sent word to luca wurfl, and he sent in some good comments
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (18:08): f4dfad803df83144a5be86d9bca87678: is your employer in the business of creating/selling tranforming proxies?
f4dfad803df83144a5be86d9bca87678 (18:11): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: how is validator.nu traffic? are many people using the gnu error format output?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (18:11): f4dfad803df83144a5be86d9bca87678: I don't have up-to-date hard data, but my impression is that gnu and json are more popular than xml
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (18:13): lol. XML is so unpopular I might as well remove it
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (18:14): HTML is the most popular output format (obviously)
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (18:15): then from more popular to less popular: gnu, text, json, xml, xhtml
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (18:16): those were for the HTML5 facet
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (18:16): note that Hixie uses out=gnu a lot
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (18:16): for the generic facet:
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (18:17): html, json, xml, xhtml, gnu, text
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (18:17): looks like people who use the html5 facet don't love XML
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (18:17): but XML seems worth keeping because it's used on the generic side
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (18:18): my sed skills, suck. otherwise, I'd calculate some per-unique-IP numbers
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (18:19): s/skills,/skills/
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (18:20): tries perl instead
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (18:26): unique IP order for generic: html, xml, xhtml, gnu, json, text
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (18:27): unique IP order for HTML5: html, text, gnu, json, xml, xhtml

f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (18:30): watching the opening ceremony, I really don't understand why all the countries came out in a seemingly random order, with Australia finally coming out second last.
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (18:31): interestingly, the HTML5 facet is used more than the generic facet from browsers, but the generic facet is more popular than the HTML5 facet as a Web service
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (18:31): in terms of unique client IPs
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (18:31): at first, it was on in chinese before switching to a norwegian stream, so I had no chance of undetstanding anything.
bb76dfcc4f591df0120c3ef31743d8e2 (18:36): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: Maybe people don't like writing long URLs in their code :)

b07211a0c7cb119232799d2119cea90f (18:41): what price range are you looking at?
